body_html: If you need linear algebra on the CPU, AMD is not the best choice, I agree. Recent Intel CPUs (core i9) are twice as wide per core. Even with fewer cores and thermal throttling they are going to outperform AMD. Our workload, however, does not, and will not require much from the CPU aside from data augmentation (which is quite elaborate) and JPEG decoding, so for us Threadripper is a good choice.

Even with fewer cores and thermal throttling they are going to outperform AMD. Our workload, however, does not, and will not require much from the CPU aside from data augmentation (which is quite elaborate) and JPEG decoding, so for us Threadripper is a good choice.
